Description: Fragment of a heavily worn green-blue glazed composition tile (?), decorated with leg of a running figure, probably of a man, in raised relief. At the bottom there is a horizontal groove, indicating the edge of the object. Booted leg, with projecting curled 'tongue ' at top of boot possibly marked with vertical stripes in dark glaze, ending below the knee. Leg is in high relief, with considerable damage to surface. Scar of another feature visble to left. Glaze - pale green (eau de nil) Ptolemaic type, much lifted off, the back is unglazed, although might have been abraded off, because some faint trace on one corner. Core- cream colour, fine texture, medium soft.
Curator's comments: Compare with another fragment in G & R 1924. 1201. 82
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AC.17)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Committe of)
